qas.question: What ruler decreed the change to the Gregorian calendar?
Besides part of Italy, over what areas did Phillip rule?
What was the first day selected to be the first day using the new calendar?
What was the last day the Julian calendar was used?
Why did the Spanish colonies lag behind in adopting the calendar?
What King decreed the change from the Gregorian to the Julian calendar?
Who was affected by Philip II's switch to the Julian calendar?
What changed Julian Thursday, 4 October 1582 to Gregorian Friday, 15 October 1582?
What calendar was last used on Friday, October 15 1582?

context: <a0_0><b5_0>Philip II of Spain<b5_0/><a0_0/> decreed the change from the <b8_0>Julian<b8_0/> to the Gregorian calendar, which affected <b6_0>much of Roman Catholic Europe<b6_0/>, as Philip was at the time ruler over <a1_0>Spain and Portugal<a1_0/> as well as much of Italy. In these territories, as well as in the Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth (ruled by Anna Jagiellon) and in the Papal States, the new calendar was implemented on the date specified by <b7_0>the bull<b7_0/>, with Julian <a3_0>Thursday, 4 October 1582<a3_0/>, being followed by Gregorian <a2_0>Friday, 15 October 1582<a2_0/>. The Spanish and Portuguese colonies followed somewhat later de facto because of <a4_0>delay in communication<a4_0/>.
